item.title: Corporate Personhood
item.description: Corporate Personhood is the concept that corporate entities should be extended many (but not all) of the same rights that the constitution grants to individuals, on the basis that a corporation is simply a collection of like minded individuals. But as Kate Cox writes in “How Corporations Got The Same Rights As People (But Don’t Ever Go To Jail),” “[C]orporations are not actually living, breathing, physical beings. They cannot go to jail, they cannot lose their lives, and they do not think or feel.
